Title: util-linux: Local privilege escalation
Synopsis:
The mount and umount programs might allow local attackers to gain root
    privileges.

Background.Text: util-linux is a suite of Linux programs including mount and umount, programs used to mount and unmount filesystems.

Description.Text: Ludwig Nussel discovered that the check_special_mountprog() and check_special_umountprog() functions call setuid() and setgid() in the wrong order and do not check the return values, which can lead to privileges being dropped improperly.

Impact.Text: A local attacker may be able to exploit this vulnerability by using mount helpers such as the mount.nfs program to gain root privileges and run arbitrary commands.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All util-linux users should upgrade to the latest version:
